Sequence Information.Peptide Name: MB-21 (Ala-rich; Leu-rich; Synthetic AMPs20, XXA, XXE; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  N-terminal acetylation and C-terminal amidation improve peptide stability. K,L-rich.Activity: It is most active against E. coli and S. aureus (WO9628468 & WO9716973). It also antifungal (APPl Environ Microbiol 1998; 64: 4047-52). The peptide can lyse liposomes (Biochem 2000; 39: 11907-12). For a related entry, see AP1240.Structure:  said helix (evidence?). Deposited2009. Provided by Bhakoo M.
Literature Information.Author: Bhakoo M, Patel S, and Stott IP
Literature Information.Title: Preparation of amphiphilic antimicrobial peptides and analogues.
